text: the first thing you need to do in order
to clear is create an oasis in which to
live your Oasis is your safe place your
toxic free zone where your load has been
significantly reduced as if we didn't
already have enough to worry about it
seems like there's always some new
epidemic or tropical disease or other
medical anxiety floating around out
there but does this threat come from
outside from the external environment or
does it come from within this is one of
the questions posed by Todd Haynes's
brilliant safe which I think may be the
most disturbing American movie of the
last 20 years
Julianne Moore plays Carroll a housewife
in the San Fernando Valley who develops
a chemical sensitivity and then either
falls desperately ill or else falls
completely apart Carroll seeks refuge in
a residential treatment center called
renwood it's out in the New Mexico
desert it's run by an hiv-positive
self-help guru and staff by his loyal
and adoring minions when I got here all
I could do is just sit in my safe room
and every day every hour of every day I
would look at myself in the mirror and I
would say to myself Claire I love you
I really love you
at the end of the month I could leave my
room and shortly thereafter I was
walking one of the most intriguing
things about safe is the way that Todd
Haynes modulates the tone and the mood
this movie is a satire of American
suburbia and therapeutic culture and so
I transform that negative stimulus into
something that will not do harm to me it
also evokes a rich tradition of Southern
California film noir and it's at least
as terrifying as any horror movie I've
ever seen Carol oh my god
Linda what happened she can't breathe
Carlene call her house someone should
call her doctor and Jennifer could you
get some water please just try relax
okay
what makes safe especially unsettling is
that even though it's set in 1987 it
seems to get closer and closer to
contemporary reality and Carroll even as
she takes more and more extreme steps to
protect herself becomes more and more
vulnerable are these dangers really out
there in the world or are they just all
in our heads neither answer is really
likely to make us feel much better or to
make us feel safe
I love you
I really love you
